description: Using these attributes, you can set the chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels)
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets whether the caption should be bold formatted
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Sets whether the sub-caption should be bold formatted
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of the chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets whether to show legend on the chart.
attrs.name: showLegend

attrs.description: Sets whether legend keys should be bold formatted.
attrs.name: legendItemFontBold

attrs.description: Sets the legend item font size
attrs.name: legendItemFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the legend position on the chart. The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below (__BOTTOM__) the chart and to the right (__RIGHT__) of the chart.
attrs.name: legendPosition

description: In multi-series charts, the series name of each data-set shows up in the legend of the chart. If you do not need the legend, you can opt to hide the same. Also, the legend can be placed at the bottom of the chart or to the right of the chart. Using the attributes below, you can configure the functional and cosmetic properties of the legend.
